ygData.subject: Re: restlet error when add seeds to action directory
ygData.msgSnippet: I m using heritrix 3.0.0 and restlet 1.1.6. I have solved the problem by adding more restlet realted jars into classpath. Original, the classpath contains

I'm using heritrix 3.0.0 and restlet 1.1.6. I have solved the problem by ad=
ding more restlet realted jars into classpath. Original, the classpath cont=
ains com.noelios.restlet.jar, com.noelios.restlet.ext.jetty.jar and org.res=
tlet.jar.
 The added jars include ext.servlet, ext.freemarker, ext.jaxrs, e=
xt.jibx, ext.spring, ext.grizzly, ext.ssl, ext.net, ext.oauth, ext.httpclie=
nt, ext.json...... 
I'm not sure which one effects action directory process=
. It will be much easier if a classnotfoundexception is thrown.

My crawler=
-beans.cxml is mostly defaulted except I override the CrawlController.atFin=
ish(), which will always return false to make the job waiting for new seeds=
 in action directory.

Toppi

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Noah =
Levitt <nlevitt@...> wrote:
>
> I'm unable to reproduce this problem, using=
 svn HEAD.
>

ix are you using? Do you see any other warnings or errors in the logs befor=
e you attempt to retrieve the seeds report? What kinds of customizations ha=
ve you made to crawler-beans.cxml? (If you like, you can send me your confi=
g offline)
> 
> The format you describe for .seeds should be fine.
> 
> Noa=
h
> 
>

ile to action directory, heritrix gives a warning: "thread-10 com.noelios.r=

ity was returned. Ignoring the entity for resource "https://localhost:8443/=
engine/job/test2/report/SeedsReport.". Then, the seedsReport shows "0 notcr=
awled http://address.com". All the seeds in crawler-bean.cxml has been down=
load, which indicates the engine and config is OK. But the seeds added thro=
ugh action directory are uncrawled. What is the problem?

 file contains a single line "http://address.com/". Is it the right format?=
